meanings.sent1: The small dog began to beshiver in the cold wind.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake made the ground beshiver beneath our feet.
meanings.sent3: The leaf continued to beshiver even after the wind had stopped.
meanings.sent4: Her voice caused him to beshiver with fear.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder made the windows beshiver in their frames.

meanings.definition: To cause to shake or tremble violently.
meanings.sent1: The loud music beshivered the glass on the table.
meanings.sent2: The scary movie scene beshivered the audience with fear.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loved to beshiver his toys off the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind beshivered the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The intense emotion in her voice beshivered his resolve.
